title: Katie Price hit with two-year driving ban 12 months after Range Rover crash
text:

Katie Price has been slapped with her fourth driving ban in the space of two years after failing to tell police who was driving her Range Rover when it crashed last October.

She has been banned from the road for two years and failed to turn up to Bexley Magistrates' Court in person - choosing instead to appear on Flex FM radio station with her friend Rick Live.

Price, who pleaded guilty to the charge at a hearing in August, refused to attend today's sentencing hearing at Bexley, claiming she was only due to return to London Gatwick Airport at 9am this morning.

Her solicitors sought to adjourn the hearing to another date, which had already been moved from August.

(Image: Instagram)

In a statement read to the court by the clerk, Price's solicitors said: "She has been out of the country.

"She is returning on the morning of the hearing.

"We ask for the hearing to be adjourned to another date. No-one will be inconvenienced as witnesses will not need to be called as a result of the guilty plea."

But Geraldine Dickinson, prosecuting, urged the court to carry on with the matter in Price's absence.

She said: "Her solicitors knew about this date and knew about her whereabouts and that she's be returning to Gatwick this morning.

(Image: Instagram)

"Even if she came back at 9am, she could have made an appearance at this court today."

District Judge Robert Hunter said: "This hearing has already been adjourned once.

"This date was agreed by both sides. I am not inclined to further adjourn this matter."

The prosecutor pointed to Price's previous disqualifications, such as a three month ban in July 2018 and a further three month back in October 2018. Six points were added to Price's licence in January 2019.

The District Judge said: "I am imposing another six points, which amounts to a disqualification of two years to the licence.

"I am also imposing a fine of £440, a surcharge of £44 and prosecution costs of £100 to be paid in 28 days."

(Image: Tim P. Whitby/Getty Images)

Price claimed at the hearing in August that she had been working to get her life back on track, and blamed the incident on her mental health and post-traumatic stress disorder.

The mum-of-five repeatedly denied she had been driving and claimed the driver was her on-off boyfriend Kris Boyson's pal - and anyone was insured to drive her pink car if they were aged over 30.

Price currently stars in the reality show My Crazy Life, but is facing bankruptcy.

The former Loose Women panellist is in the midst of renovating her nine-bedroom Sussex home.

She recently refuted claims that she will be forced to give up her home as she is due back in court over bankruptcy repayments next week.

Price is due to appear before a specialist insolvency and companies court in London on Monday.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

The TV personality avoided bankruptcy last December after reaching an agreement over a £22,000 tax bill.

But it has been claimed that she could lost her home over the bankruptcy hearing.

The 41-year-old mum of five was found to be almost twice the legal limit when she was arrested in the early hours of October 10, 2018, after a boozy night out with boyfriend Kris Boyson for his 30th birthday,

Katie was found in the back seat of her Barbie pink 4x4, wearing a hoodie, socks and no pants.

Officers reported she smelled of alcohol, had bloodshot eyes and was slurring after her car veered off the road and crashed into shrubbery.

(Image: Youtube)

She was cleared of drink-driving at a court appearance in February 2019 but found guilty of a separate charge of being drunk in charge of a vehicle, for which she received a three-month ban and a fine of £1,500, plus costs and a victim surcharge adding up to a total of £2,425.

Katie had claimed in court she was not in control of the car at the time of the crash, alleging instead that an unnamed friend of Kris' had been driving.

The mystery man, she and Boyson both insisted, had run away after swerving into the hedge, and Kris had told Katie to "shut up" when cops asked who was driving.

But District Judge Nigel Dean told the court that Katie was not a credible witness.
description: Katie Price has had her driving licence taken off her again after failing to tell police who was driving when her vomit-covered pink Range Rover crashed into a hedge last October
